title: Heads and tales, or, Anecdotes and stories of quadrupeds and other beasts chiefly connected with incidents in the histories of more or less distinguished men /
snippet: But to the Culter " Luath," to hear was to obey j and in a quarter of an hour a flock of sheep, which had been feeding on a hillside  half a mile off, were brought back, driven by this faithful "bit doggie."
